title: Scary clown delivering doughnuts frightens meteorologist on live broadcast
text:
CLOSE

PHOENIX – Who doesn’t like doughnuts?

April Warnecke, for one – at least not when they are delivered by a scary clown while she is on the air.

Warnecke, a meteorologist for "Good Morning Arizona," was starting to do the weather during Monday morning’s broadcast when a scary-looking clown walked right into the shot.

Warnecke’s reaction was funny and a little disturbing – as in, she was disturbed. She walked off the weather set and its green screen and into the news set, where the clown followed her. "Good Morning Arizona" anchor Javier Soto seemed to find it particularly funny.

“Javier, is this you?” Warnecke said as she walked off. For the rest of the clown’s stay, Warnecke kept her back to him, never looking at him. Soto hugged the clown, who bore a box of Hurts doughnuts. Co-anchor Olivia Fierro recorded it all on her smartphone.

.@aprilwarnecke had a surprise guest during Good Morning, Arizona...a SCARY DONUT CLOWN!



Let's just say she didn't enjoy it as much as @JavierSotoTV 🤣🍩🤡 pic.twitter.com/l2l0aBTX3R — azfamily 3TV CBS 5 (@azfamily) October 7, 2019

Unexpected guest: Escaped goat breaks into Ohio home through glass door, takes nap in bathroom

“I’m not afraid of clowns in general,” Warnecke said in an email Tuesday. “Just scary clowns. Really – just anything scary. And who wants anything or anybody jumping at you during a live broadcast?! It’s pretty jarring.”

And pretty funny, too.

"I've also had haunted house characters, Mrs. Claus and several comedians surprise me live on the green screen over the past 14 years at KVTK," Warnecke said.

Someday maybe she'll get used to it. But Monday was definitely not that day.
